intro: Alchornea costaricensis f. longispicata, commonly known as the long-spined alchornea, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by bracts. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. This species is adapted to tropical and subtropical environments, often found in moist, shaded areas.
